avalancheActivity.comment: Avalanche danger is moderate. At low and intermediate altitudes, small wet loose-snow avalanches can be expected in very steep starting zones due to rain seepage. Above 2000m in some places even one person can trigger a small, in seldom occurrences medium-sized slab avalanche. Danger zones occur on W/N/E facing steep slopes, often distant from ridgelines. Caution urged especially at entry points into very steep gullies and bowls. On very steep grass-covered slopes, isolated small glide-snow avalanches are possible.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Poor visibility hinders danger assessment at high altitude

snowpackStructure.comment: On shady high altitudes slopes, trigger-sensitive snowdrift accumulations lie deposited atop a faceted old snowpack surface. On sunny slopes following a night of much reduced outgoing radiation, breakable melt-freeze crusts prevail. Rain seepage is burdening the already heavily moistened snowpack.

tendency.highlights: Following a night of overcast skies on Monday night, rapid loss of snowpack firmness on sunny slopes on Tuesday. At high altitudes persistent snowdrift problem on north-facing slopes.

weatherForecast.comment: During the nocturnal hours cloud cover will become more dense amid strong to storm-strength foehn winds. On Monday, many peaks will be shrouded in fog. In early morning, light-to-moderate rainfall up to 2000m. Above that altitude a few centimetres of fresh snow is anticipated. Ongoing strong-to-stormy southerly winds. At 2000m: 0 degrees; at 3000m: -5 degrees.

avalancheActivity.comment: Avalanche danger below 1800m is moderate. Due to the rainfall, small wet loose-snow avalanches can be expected in very steep starting zones.  Above 2000m in some places even one person can trigger a small, in seldom occurrences medium-sized slab avalanche. Danger zones occur on W/N/E facing steep slopes, often distant from ridgelines. Caution urged especially at entry points into very steep gullies and bowls. On very steep grass-covered slopes, isolated small glide-snow avalanches are possible.
avalancheActivity.highlights: In case of rain showers, snowpack will lose its firmness

snowpackStructure.comment: On shady high-altitude slopes, small-area trigger-sensitive snowdrift accumulations lie deposited atop a faceted old snowpack. Elsewhere, after a night of much reduced outgoing radation, breakable melt-freeze crusts, quickly softening in case of solar radiation. Rain seepage is burdening the already heavily moistened snowpack.

tendency.highlights: On Tuesday, after a night of often clear skies, melt-freeze crusts and firn on sunny slopes, elsewhere no change.

weatherForecast.comment: During the nocturnal hours cloud cover will become more dense amid strong to storm-strength foehn winds. On Monday, many peaks will be shrouded in fog. In early morning, light-to-moderate rainfall up to 2000m. Above that altitude a few centimetres of fresh snow is anticipated. Ongoing strong-to-stormy southerly winds. At 2000m: 0 degrees; at 3000m: -5 degrees.

avalancheActivity.comment: Avalanche danger is low. Freshly generated snowdrift accumulations can be trigger a small slab avalanche in steep terrain by one sole skie. Above 2000m esp. in the Tauern, even one person can trigger a small slab avalanche. Danger zones occur on W/N/E facing steep slopes, often distant from ridgelines. Caution urged especially at entry points into very steep gullies and bowls. On very steep grass-covered slopes, isolated small glide-snow avalanches are possible.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Loose-snow avalanches, only isolated danger zones for slab avalanches

snowpackStructure.comment: On shady high-altitude slopes in the Tauern, small-area trigger-sensitive snowdrift accumulations lie deposited atop a faceted old snowpack. Elsewhere, after a night of much reduced outgoing radation, breakable melt-freeze crusts, quickly softening in case of solar radiation. Only on north-facing slopes above 1500m is the snow still dry. Rain seepage is burdening the already heavily moistened snowpack.

tendency.highlights: On Tuesday, after a night of often clear skies, melt-freeze crusts and firn o sunny slopes, elsewhere no change.

weatherForecast.comment: During the nocturnal hours cloud cover will become more dense amid strong to storm-strength foehn winds. On Monday, many peaks will be shrouded in fog. In early morning, light-to-moderate rainfall up to 2000m. In afternoon t clouds will disperse. Ongoing strong-to-stormy southerly winds. At 2000m: 0-3 degrees; at 3000m: -5 degrees.

customData.generalHeadline: Snowpack: fewer cold reserves, often rain seepage
